text:
If I make a typo in the name of a standard action, e.g. <jsp:userBean> instead
of <jsp:useBean>, no error is reported. According to the spec, a transaltion
error should occur if an action using a defined prefix is found with a name that
does not match an action in the corresponding library; this must apply to both
standard actions (with the "jsp" prefix) and custom actions.
creator: hans@gefionsoftware.com

text: Note that jasper2 does not have this problem.
creator: kin-man.chung@sun.com

text:
Created attachment 1847
JSP Page showing the lack of error

text:

Fix for this bug, first iteration
creator: edburns@acm.org
edburns@acm.org
text:
Kin-Man,

Please review this fix.  It throws a ParseException if someone tries to use any 
of the reservedPrefixes with an unrecognized shortTagName.

Ed

creator: kin-man.chung@sun.com
text:
Ed,

Looks good.  Some minor comments.

1. Reuse of the error message jsp.error.taglib.reserved.prefix is confusing,
since we are not dealing with taglib here.  Better to use a new message.

2. I am not sure it's necessary to check again the list of reserved prefixes.  I
think spec says some prefixes are not to be used for custom tags, which requires
a <%@ taglib  declaration, it doesn't say if you can use it in a template text. 
Your fix may be controversial.  I think it sufficient to just check for <jsp:
for now.  I am not 100% sure about this though.

3. The message contains the string <jsp:, which will be "eaten" when displayed. 
You should URL encode "<".
